content.text:
# List of Cultural Properties of Japan – archaeological materials (Okinawa)

This list is of the Cultural Properties of Japan designated in the category of  for the Prefecture of Okinawa.
National Cultural Properties
As of 1 January 2015, two Important Cultural Properties have been designated, being of national significance.
{| class="wikitable sortable"  style="width:100%;"
|-

!width="10%" align="left" | Date
!width="10%" align="left" | Municipality

| align="center"|Excavated Artefacts from Sefa-utakiOkinawa-ken sēfā utaki shutsudo-hin ||  || Nanjō || Nanjō City(kept at the ) || 562 items, comprising 9 magatama (3 of gold), ten pieces of celadon, 9 gold coins (, and 534 copper coins (); Sefa-utaki is an Historic Site and part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site Gusuku Sites and Related Properties of the Kingdom of Ryukyu || ||  || [https://kunishitei.bunka.go.jp/heritage/detail/201/10498 ]
|-
| align="center"|Excavated Ceramics from the Site of Shuri CastleOkinawa-ken Shuri-jō kyō no uchi ato shutsudo tōjiki ||  || Nishihara || Okinawa Prefecture(kept at the  || 518 items; Shuri Castle is an Historic Site and part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site Gusuku Sites and Related Properties of the Kingdom of Ryukyu || ||  || [https://kunishitei.bunka.go.jp/heritage/detail/201/10431 ]
|-
|}
Prefectural Cultural Properties
As of 1 May 2014, two properties have been designated at a prefectural level.
{| class="wikitable sortable"  style="width:100%;"
|-

!width="10%" align="left" | Date

|-
| align="center"|Excavated Artefacts from Kogachibaru Shell MoundKogachibaru kaizuka shutsudo-hin ||  || Nishihara || Okinawa Prefecture(kept at the  || 234 items, comprising 30 pieces of earthenware, 101 stone tools, 58 artefacts made of shell, 39 of bone, and 6 of stone; Kogachibaru Shell Mound is in Uruma City || ||  || [http://www.pref.okinawa.lg.jp/edu/bunkazai/edu/jimukyoku/bunkazai/documents/h26011.pdf ]
|-
| align="center"|Excavated Artefacts from Shimotabaru Shell MoundShimotabaru kaizuka shutsudo-hin ||  || Nishihara || Okinawa Prefecture(kept at the  || 209 items, comprising 1 piece of earthenware (and a further 85 fragments), 45 stone tools, 137 artefacts of shell, and 26 of bone; Shimotabaru Shell Mound on Hateruma, Taketomi, is a Prefectural Historic Site || ||  || [http://www.pref.okinawa.lg.jp/edu/bunkazai/edu/jimukyoku/bunkazai/documents/h26011.pdf ]
|-
|}
Municipal Cultural Properties
As of 1 May 2014, one property has been designated at a municipal level.
